tn.text: Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Moses speaks of victory as if it were a physical object one person could give to another. AT: "enables you to defeat them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Here "them" refers to the seven nations from [[:en:bible:notes:deu:07:01|7:1]].
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"If you allow your children to marry the people from the other nations, the people from the other nations will"

tn.ref: So the anger of Yahweh will be kindled against you
tn.text: Moses compares Yahweh's anger to someone starting a fire. This emphasizes Yahweh's power to destroy what makes him angry. This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will kindle his anger against you" or "Then Yahweh will become very angry with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "you" refers to all the Israelites and so is plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you will deal ... you will break ... dash ... cut ... burn
tn.text: Moses is speaking to all the Israelites here, so these words are all plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Moses tells the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: you are a nation that is set apart
tn.text: Yahweh choosing the people of Israel to belong to him in a special way is spoken of as if Yahweh set them apart from all other nations. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: that are on the face of the earth
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "that live on the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words. All instances of "you" and "your" are plural. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: did not set his love upon you
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "did not love you more than he loved others" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "a mighty hand" refers to Yahweh's power. AT: "with his mighty power." These words also appear in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:34|4:34]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: redeemed you out of the house of bondage
tn.text: Moses speaks of Yahweh rescuing the people of Israel from being slaves as if Yahweh had paid money to a slave owner. AT: "rescued you from being slaves" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Here the metonym "house of bondage" refers to Egypt, the place where the people of Israel had been slaves. AT: "out of the place where you were slaves." Translate these words as in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:06:10|6:12]].
Here "hand" means "the control of." AT: "control of Pharaoh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"for 1,000 generations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: repays those who hate him to their face
tn.text: This idiom means "repays them quickly and openly so that they know God has punished them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: he will not be lenient on whoever hates him
tn.text: "Yahweh will severely punish everyone who hates him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])

Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words. He speaks as if the Israelites are one person in verse 12 and to all of them as a group in verse 13. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"and increase the number of your people"
This is an idiom for "your children." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom for "your crops." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"your cattle so they will become many"
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You will be blessed more than all other peoples
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will bless you more than I bless any other people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: there will not be a childless male or a barren female among you or among your cattle
tn.text: Moses uses a negative statement to emphasize that they all will be able to have children. This may be stated in a positive form. AT: "All of you will be able to have children and your cattle will be able to reproduce" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
The words "you" and "your" are plural here. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: take away from you all sickness
tn.text: "make sure that you do not become ill" or "keep you completely healthy"

tn.ref: none of the evil diseases ... will he put on you, but he will put them on all those who hate you
tn.text: Moses speaks as if disease were a heavy object that Yahweh would put on top of people. AT: "he will not make you sick with any of the evil diseases ... but he will make your enemies sick with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: You will consume all the people groups
tn.text: "I command you to completely destroy all the people groups"

tn.ref: your eye will not pity them
tn.text: This is a command. Moses speaks as if what the eye sees were the eye itself. AT: "do not allow what you see to cause you to pity them" or "do not pity them because you see that what you are doing is hurting them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"never worship"

tn.ref: that will be a trap for you
tn.text: If the people worship other gods, they will be like an animal caught in a hunter's trap, and they will be unable to escape. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: If you say in your heart ... do not be afraid
tn.text: The people should not be afraid even if they notice that the nations are stronger than they are. AT: "Even if you say in your heart"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is an idiom. AT: "think" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

Moses uses a question to emphasize that the people may feel afraid of the other nations. This question can be translated as a statement. AT: "I cannot defeat them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
This is an idiom. AT: "you must remember" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here "eyes" refers to what the people saw. AT: "that you saw" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: the mighty  hand, and the outstretched arm
tn.text: Here "a mighty hand" and "an outstretched arm" are metaphors for Yahweh's power. AT: "and the mighty power." Translate this as it is in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:04:34|4:34]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"And also"
Possible meanings are 1) God will send actual flying insects that sting people and cause pain, or 2) God will cause the people to become terrified and want to run away.
This is an idiom. AT: "die so you do not see them anymore" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"Never"
"a great and awesome God" or "a great God who causes the people to fear"
"slowly"
Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words as if the Israelites are one person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is an idiom. AT: "enable you to defeat" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"victory over the armies from the other nations"
"he will make them so they cannot think clearly"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "until you have destroyed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you will make their name perish from under heaven
tn.text: The Israelites will completely destroy all the people from those nations, and in the future no one will remember them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
"stand against you" or "defend themselves against you"

Moses continues to tell the people of Israel Yahweh's words. In verse 25 he speaks to the group as a group, so the forms of "you" are plural, but in verse 26 he speaks as if the Israelites are one person, so the forms are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This is a command.
"the gods of the other nations"

tn.ref: do not covet ... trapped by it
tn.text: These words add to the instruction to burn the idols.

tn.ref: you will become trapped by it
tn.text: Even taking the gold or silver on the idols could cause the people to start worshiping them. By doing this they would become like an animal caught by a trap. This can be stated in active form. AT: "it will become a trap to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: for it is an abomination to Yahweh your God
tn.text: These words tell why Yahweh wants the people to burn the idols. "do this because Yahweh your God hates it very much"

tn.ref: You will utterly detest and abhor
tn.text: The words "detest" and "abhor" mean basically the same thing and emphasize the intensity of hatred. AT: "You will completely hate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: for it is set apart for destruction
tn.text: Yahweh cursing something and promising to destroy it is spoken of as if Yahweh were setting the object apart from everything else. This can be stated in active form. AT: "for Yahweh has set it apart for destruction" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
